subject: AI
title: Tools vs Retrieval (When to RAG)
description: One-minute skill: Tools vs Retrieval (When to RAG).

hook.text: Need a fact? Retrieve. Need an effect? Use a tool.

buildup.text: Tools change the world; retrieval changes what the agent knows.

discovery.text: Ask one question: are we missing information, or are we missing an action?

twist.text: A common trap is using RAG to avoid doing the actual work the tool is for.

climax.text: Pick retrieval for knowledge, tools for operations. Mixing them up creates confusion and brittle systems.

punchline.text: Facts come from retrieval; effects come from tools.

quiz.question: When should you prefer retrieval?
options: When you need an irreversible side effect
When you want to send emails
When you want to write to a DB
